TEXT.TITLE: PHILIPPINES, WORLD BANK SIGN 310 MLN DLR PACKAGE
TEXT.BODY: The Philippines and the World Bank have signed a 300 mln dlr loan and 10 mln dlr worth of technical assistance to help Manila in its economic recovery efforts, bank officials said . The loan, to be disbursed in three equal tranches, is repayable over 20 years, including a five-year grace period, with a variable interest rate, currently at 7.92 pct. The loan was signed by Finance Minister Jaime Ongpin and A. Karasmasoglu, World Bank vice-president for East Asia and the Pacific. Ongpin said the first tranche of 100 mln dlrs was expected within a month. REUTER
